item.title: Basics of Database Design: Normalization, Relationships, and ER Diagrams
item.description: Database design is a critical phase in creating a robust, scalable, and efficient database system. It involves structuring data in a way that ensures it can be stored, retrieved, and managed effectively. Some key concepts fundamental to database design are Normalization, Relationships, and Entity-Relationship (ER) Diagrams. Let's explore these concepts in detail. 1. Normalization Normalizat
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K
